description: Borrowed from Hebrew קידוש‎ (kidúsh, “kiddush”, literally “sanctification”). Doublet of kaddish.

entries.meaning: A blessing recited over wine or grape juice in commemoration of the sanctity of the Shabbat or other Jewish holy day.
examples: Cohn began the seder with a kiddush for wine, and the first two toasts he proposed were the traditional ones to life and to freedom.
